concept.title: Migrating to tag management 2.0 from tag management 1.0
concept.shortdesc: Tag management provides a migration wizard and tag backward compatibility to help migrate from tag management 1.0.

conbody.p: The migration process is designed to keep your live tag management 1.0 implementation operational throughout the migration. The following table contains details on each of the migration steps:

entry.p: Start the tag container Migration Wizard.
The tag management 2.0 page code is backward compatible with 1.0 tag containers.

During the migration, your live 1.0 tag container and development 2.0 tag container can use the same 2.0 page code. This lets you migrate your page code first, then test and deploy a 2.0 tag container without disrupting your live implementation.
Create a 2.0 revision of the tag container and migrate your tags. See .
Deploy and test the 2.0 tag container in the dev and stage environments to make sure everything works correctly.
When testing is complete, promote the 2.0 tag container to the live environment.

conbody.p: The tag management 1.0 guide is available for reference during your migration.

section.title: Upgrade the Tag Container
section.p: Edit your 1.0 tag container, and under the Upgrade to tag management 2.0 heading, click the Upgrade this Container button. This starts the Migration Wizard.

section.title: Update Page Code
section.note: Do not edit the page code in your live environment until you have completed Step 5 and have deployed a 2.0 tag container to live and verified the deployment status.
section.p: Replace your existing 1.0 page code with the 2.0 page code in a dev environment. The 2.0 page code should be inserted directly after the opening <body> tag. For now, the 2.0 page code continues to reference the 1.0 tag container.
After the new page code is deployed, click the I have deployed the Page Code button.

section.title: Create a 2.0 Revision
section.p: After the page code is deployed, click Create Revision. This creates a new 2.0 tag container in the dev environment. Your live 1.0 tag container continues to operate in the live environment.
Because of the new structure of tag management 2.0 containers, you need to recreate your 1.0 tags using 2.0 tags. See .

section.title: Deploy and Test
section.p: Deploy and test the 2.0 tag container in the dev and stage environments to make sure everything works correctly.

section.title: Promote to Live
section.p: When testing is complete, promote the 2.0 tag container to the live environment. After you have verified that the tag container is deployed to live, you can update the page code in your live environment.
